Title:
Penicillium kongii, a new species of sect. Brevicompacta
isolated from plant leaves in China
Abstract:
A unique Penicillium species isolated from plant leaves is
reported here, presenting restricted growth, complex terverticillate
penicillin, ovoid to ellipsoidal conidia, and characteristically
producing red soluble pigment on yeast extract-sucrose agar (YES). This
new taxon is described as P. kongii sp. nov., which belongs to subgenus
Penicillium sect. Brevicompacta and is morphologically similar to P.
bialowiezense and P. brevicompactum. Phylogenetic analyses on the basis
of sequence data using parts of calmodulin gene, Î²-tubulin gene and
rDNA ITS1-5.8S-ITS2 showed that it represented a phylogenetically
distinctive clade.
